FuncDef: The display acl statistics command displays ACL-based traffic policy statistics.
CLIs: display acl ipv6 { <acl-number> | name <acl-name> | all } statistics

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an ACL.
For IPv4 ACL, the value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 4999, 6000 to 10999.The number of an interface ACL ranges from 1000 to 1999.The number of a basic ACL ranges from 2000 to 2999.The number of an advanced ACL ranges from 3000 to 3999.The number of a Layer 2 ACL ranges from 4000 to 4999.The number of a user-defined ACL ranges from 6000 to 9999.The number of an MPLS-based ACL ranges from 10000 to 10999.

For IPv6 ACL, The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 3999, 6000 to 9999.The number of an interface ACL ranges from 1000 to 1999. The number of a basic ACL6 ranges from 2000 to 2999.The number of an advanced ACL6 ranges from 3000 to 3999.The number of a user-defined ACL6 ranges from 6000 to 9999.

Specifies the name of an ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z, case sensitive).

Examples: Info: No ACL statistics are displayed for classifier working in And mode or casc
ading policies that are not supported.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check ACL-based traffic policy statistics, run the display acl statistics command.
Prerequisites
The statistics collecting function has been enabled on the interface to which the traffic policy applies.
Precautions
This command does not display ACL-based statistics about traffic policies in which traffic classifiers are configured to work in AND relationships using the traffic classifier command or on the board that does not support cascaded traffic policies.
This command does not have a corresponding MIB object.
